Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with an angled nozzle, decorated on the discus with a bull. The shoulder is decorated with ovules; on each side of the nozzle volute is a leaf-shaped stamp. The lamp stands on a raised base. Light brown clay, with mica covered with a brown slip. Plaster mould.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q1955)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs W N Weech
